ygData.subject: once again-- re on all
ygData.msgSnippet: Been reading up on a lot of different opinions here. Will try to summarize. 1) Snare isn t as easy to get taunted off as the rest. Not if I do it right
ygData.messageBody:
Been reading up on a lot of different opinions
here. Will try to summarize.<br><br>1) Snare isn't as
easy to get taunted off as the rest. Not if I do it
right away. If I wait for the taunters and damage
dealers to do a bit first... then....<br><br>Here's the
way to agro like you wouldn't believe.<br><br>As the
tank runs up, snare the mob and DS the tank. Almost
always-- any adds and often the snared-- will run to you.
If you're pulling, snare and dot. By the time it
gets to your party-- it'll take ages to get the mob
off you. <br><br>Healing is another great way to have
peels and also sitting. One trick I do is, first-- agro
like mad. Then when finally, it gets pulled off me...
I back up a tick away. Sit... med a tick. Mob's
almost reached me by then. I run away and sit in time to
catch the tick. (I count off... one one thousand, two
one thousand, three one thousand-- TICK/SIT). Catch
the tick for to refresh mana with efficiency--
rinse,wash,repeat. They'll chase you for about half their life -- if
you're not with a cleric/enchanter/bard/necro-- and
doing fear kiting. This is only for group kite-- mostly
if I'm pulling or kiting adds. Rarely do I solo--
especially since my specialty is Alteration. I care little
for kiting-- BORING-- even with trying quad.
LOL.<br><br>Anyhoo-- person I'm with is getting ready to go so I need
to hurry.<br><br>2) Shaman rerinse issue. A lot of
the first 16 levels are gainable within a 24 hour
period of online time. Admittedly-- that's a long time--
almost three weeks of play for me-- but Three weeks
versus-- knowing your character and zone better, and etc.
That allows you to get a better feel for you
class.<br><br>I've restarted Druid 3 times and played numerous other
classes to level 10 or 12 just to get a feel for them.
Helps a lot for everything. I knew I wanted more
starting Wis but still liked the way I spread more points
around. I know my play style well and people love me in
groups usually-- I know what I'm doing and it usually
(USUALLY) shows.<br><br>But you can tell my inexperience
when I play my bard. Getting better-- but the agro
factors still kill me. Juggling 3 songs causes more agro
than I would think and gotta be careful about the
balance.<br><br>But in other words-- sorry for the length-- It's up
to you. If you had fun with your shaman-- in the
long run, restarting might prove very, very rewarding.
I moved to another server on the last instance and
it really proved interesting. I also tried
restarting on a same server once. Also rewarding. In the
end, I'd like to think I know as much as most druids
Level 36 and below and maybe some above-- on group
dynamics. Kiting is definately my weak point... but I can
live without kiting. It's great exp-- but
BORING.<br><br>shooman out<br>Fatedhue Prismatic <br>Drinal server--
Tribunal of Antiquities.<br><br>PS ... heh... rambling
more than usual-- friend waiting
